newsitem.title: UK: PRESS DIGEST - London-based Arab newspapers - Feb 26.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - London-based Arab newspapers - Feb 26.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in two London-based Arabic-language newspapers on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Jordan borrowed $21 million from the United States to buy wheat.
- Yemen is to receive $8.5 million from a U.N. fund to finance a housing project.
- U.S. exports to Arab countries in 1996 were worth $18.3 billion, a study showed.
- Qatar National Shipping Company's earnings in 1996 rose to 272 million riyals from 260 million in 1995.
- A joint Saudi-Swedesh food company to be set up in Saudi Arabia at a cost of around 60 million riyals.
